arm_group.description: single group evaluation of PET/ MR for diagnostic quality of image

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to gather image and associated data to demonstrate usability
      of a pre-market PET/MRI scanner and to use the data for regulatory submission and future
      product development. Clinical data is required in order to test the MR attenuation
      correction of PET data. These aims can only be accomplished through a clinical study.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of 18F FDG PET/CT TO PET MRI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria

          -  Subject must have a clinical indication for a PET/CT exam

          -  Subject must be at least eighteen (18) years of age; and

          -  If female of child bearing potential (non-child bearing include: surgically sterile
             or post-menopausal) are to have a negative urine pregnancy test ; and

          -  Subject must be able to hear and understand instructions without assistive devices;
             and

          -  Subject must provide written informed consent; and

          -  Subject has the necessary mental capacity to understand instructions, and is able to
             comply with protocol requirements; and

          -  Subject is able to remain still for duration of imaging procedure (approximately 60
             minutes total for PET/MRI); and

          -  Subject must be able to participate in a PET/MR imaging session within 1 hour of
             concluding their PET/CT exam

        Exclusion criteria

          -  Subjects who have any axial diameter larger than 55 cm; or

          -  Subjects with a weight greater than 499 lbs; or

          -  Female subjects with known or suspected pregnancy; or

          -  Subjects with any implants or external medical hardware; or

          -  Subjects who have a contraindication to MRI per the screening policy of the
             participating site

other_name: Photon Detection Ring and PET Detectors
PET Electronics (mounted to magnet) and Cables

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of 18F FDG PET/CT TO PET MRI

primary_outcome.description: Investigator indicates that the images are of diagnostic quality yes/no
